|Title=Knowing the possible complications of dysthyroid ophthalmopathy: compressive optic neuropathy, exposure keratitis, etc.
|Description=None

Possible complications of basedowian ophthalmopathy are :

- Corneal damage of variable severity, secondary to significant, non-reducible exophthalmos, with [[Palpebral anomalies SD-139|Palpebral inocclusion]].

- Neuropathy due to compression of the optic nerve, which is extremely serious, associated with [[Vision abnormality SD-138|alterations of the visual field]] which can go as far as [[Vision abnormality SD-138|blindness]].

- Involvement of one or more periorbital muscles linked to oedematous phenomena, muscle inflammation and then muscle fibrosis, most often manifested by [[Diplopia SD-143|diplopia]].

question.question: What are possible complications of dysthyroid ophthalmopathy?
question.option_a: Corneal damage of variable severity, secondary to significant, non-reducible exophthalmos, with palpebral anomalies.
question.option_b: Neuropathy due to compression of the optic nerve, which is extremely serious, associated with alterations of the visual field which can go as far as blindness.
question.option_c: Involvement of one or more periorbital muscles linked to oedematous phenomena, muscle inflammation and then muscle fibrosis, most often manifested by diplopia.
question.option_d: All of the above are possible complications of dysthyroid ophthalmopathy.
